title: It's 2015, the amount of AD Casters has skyrocketed
body:
And we STILL do not have any sort of item that can deal with them.

Thornmail? Doesn't proc abilities
Banshees? Blocks spells but no AD
Randuins? Your best bet but still getting pelted at range.
Ninja Tabi? Try again, it's only basic attacks

Why is there no item to deal with these guys? Why do we not have any tank items to build that can deal with an AD character that is primarily casting spells?

I've pointed this one out before and I'm in full agreement, the game simply doesn't have any way of dealing with an AD Caster who has some grasp of what Last Whisper does.  God help you if they run TriPen.

Since Omen lost its niche as the anti-kiting item I think it would be the best pick for an anti-physical damage item.  Remove its OnHit attack speed slow and instead give it 15% untyped damage reduction against physical damage.

That, or make Thornmail return all sources of physical damage.  Because watching Zed blow himself up on the Tank would be hilarious.

No it isn't good. You are already punished for targeting them by being unable to use your spells on valuable targets like ADC or APC, also killing yourself in the process would be overkill and would make tanks way stronger than they need to be.

First off, if you're targeting the tank there are a lot of things to consider.  

A.)  The tank is doing its job well and protecting its squishies.  You don't *have* to use any abilities on the tank.  Rammus's taunt doesn't make you push Q, W, E, or R.  Essentially, you are getting outplayed by the tank.  

B.)  You're intentionally wasting your abilities on the tank which means that you want them to be gone more than the squishy target that you yourself admit should be the focus of your abilities.  In other words, you are playing poorly, and deserve to be punished for it.  

C.)  The tank and you were fighting alone, probably in a 1v1 situation.  You both wanted the other dead, but while you have the damage to deal with the tank, the tank probably doesn't have enough damage to do much to you before it dies.  This scenario has a lot of unknown variables, but let's say you're both even in build (though different items) and health percentages.  The tank can conceivably run to safety before dying, but since most tanks are slow and most assassins/ADCasters are not (either due to gap-closers or base speed), the tank doesn't have very much time.  

With the implementation of such an item, it will make the assassins/ADCasters need to play as intelligently as their opponents.  I see very little downside to this.
There was never a "tank" meta. For a while bruisers dominated everything, but tanks were never dominant.

Blocking a spell or reducing a CD isn't punishing them. Directly damaging them for trying to deal damage to you is punishment.

Their all punishing, but in different ways. BV is a denial option: you spend resources, but get no benefit from it. Thornmail is a retributive option: you spend resources, and suffer a negative effect as a result, but still get the full benefits of the spent resource.

Because spells don't crit, and those spells that you activate,  that grant you an AA modifier have a big portion of their damage classified as AA, Rengar's Q is totally counted as AA therefore Thornmail is effective.

The reason we don't have an AD caster item block is because most AD casters either don't have enough scaling in a kit that allows them to use it at their maximum potential or because most of them are built tanky or are tanky, and won't do just enough damage to be as relevan as AA based champions that arguably scale the best in this game, that's why there's no need to to create such an item.

Those who can use their high scaling spells without impunity usually have little to no CC and are squishy as hell, albeit being somewhat safe into avoiding damage instead of tanking it, in fact of those you listed, the ones that have no escapes but they are more all in-ish, build relatively tanky (Exception Being Rengar whose kit is being continuosly changed makes him have an identity crisis as he has a perfect tool for an Assassin to engage but absolutely no way to get out outside killing or tanking the rest, but if builds tanky his ult is nigh to useless when it comes to getting the most out of it considering its potential.).

Armor already reduces the damage done by AD damage, we have special items specifically designed for AA AD based characters because of how they scale, once again critical hits in this game are without a doubt the highest form of DPS we can have around (AD casters WILL get outscaled in the long run if built properly.).

Your problem seems to be those who have BOTH, Lucian, Graves, MF, or Yasuo, Zed, RIVEN, and other champs that can use spells on top of AA, whereas there are some others that are stuck with one (Trynda or Ashe for example).

The thing is that if someone has both for those damage types it's because they have somewhat not as much utility as the rest, once again, Ashe doesn't have high damage but arguably has a very utility based kit that can somewhat win games sometimes.

I actually feel it's balanced this way, if we add specific AD spell blocking it would be a nerf to "Hybrids" (Casters that can build crit because their kit allows them to) but a complete destruction for pure casters (Talon and Kha'Zix for example, they can build crit but they don't have a standard buildpath that includes crit, especially Kha, yes crit is devasting on Talon but it's a huge gold investment into something luck based that hinders your early game, where AD casters should be at their strongest phase.).

Also AD casters because of the reasons stated above which were the AA outscaling spells lategame are much less effective against tanks anyway, when was the last time a pure caster like Talon or Kha popping a full tank without going crit builds?

Zed CAN kill in a 1vs1 under certain circumnstances BUT, it must be out of teamfights and it must be a champion sitting still eating ironically enough, all his BotRK enhanced AUTOATTACKS during his ult, whereas Zed using his spells only won't do jackshit to tanks as it does on squishies.

> Why is there no item to deal with these guys? 

Armor and HP still work against them. Not having tertiary multipliers for optimal shut-downs doesn't mean you can't itemize against them at all.

--------

As for why the optimal anti-AD Caster itemization is a little sparse, tactics.

A bruiser like Shyvana is supposed to be tanky enough to survive long enough to do her job. Counter-play against her with an assassin, mage, or marksman isn't about out-tanking her damage, it's about not letting her snuggle you to death.
So she deals 50/50 physical/magical/auto-attack/ability damage that's 100% impossible to counter-build in any meaningful way. Dealing with Shyvana isn't about mitigating her damage with tank stats. That's how bruisers deal with you. There win condition for surviving long enough to do their job is durability, out-tanking.

When it comes to mages and marksman - you can't easily position around them to negate their damage like you can a melee. Their reach and effective radius of pain is just so great you need committed items like Ninja Tabi, Thornmail, Banshee's Veil, and QSS to be available.
There win condition is out-ranging opponents and potentially using CC or mobility to never get hit in the first place.

AD casters are more often than not assassins, which is somewhere in-between those 2 groups. They're fast and agile in a burst through their kit which improves their zone of influence to a certain extent, but they're still melee and subjugated to a lot of disadvantages being melee brings.
Which, in turn, doesn't merit the same kind of durability counters you have avalible against marksman and mages.

Being melee is a significant disadvantage, melee champions need something to offset that in LoL. Riot's generally chosen "more damage when you actually get the opportunity to deal damage" as their common theme for melee champions.

Shyvana, in addition, will primarily build AS items and maybe a little AD. Except even then, her only dangerous AD spell is her Q. Otherwise, she's basically reduced to some mediocre spells and a little big of damage. 

Now you argue that a bruiser's job is durability, but the fact is that they're not really durable anymore. Unless you have some obscene steroid against damage (Braum/Alistar/etc.) you're basically going to be slaughtered because your one armor item is countered thanks to the easy penetration choices. 50% physical, 50% magical is a clear and easily provable advantage against counter building.

Assume Zed is capable of dealing 1000 damage within a 6 second window, and Shyvana is capable of dealing 500+500=1000 damage within a 6 second window.

If Shyvana purchases 100 armor against Zed, it will reduce his pre-pen damage by 50%, or down to 500.

However, if Zed purchases 100 MR, it will only bring Shyvana's damage down to 500+250=750, or 25%.
If Zed purchases 100 Armor instead, same deal - 250+500=750.
If he decides to go 50 armor and 50 MR (33% DR), then it's 333+333=667 damage.
While he's only doing 500 damage back. 

Add in Last Whisper's 35% armor pen, and you cut that 100 armor down to 65 for Shyvana, dropping it from 50% DR to 40% DR, or causing Zed to deal 600 damage post LW, while best-case scinario for him is reducing Shyvana's damage to 667.

Considering LoL King is posting Shyvana at 153,000 damage per game and Zed at 147,000, it's not a stretch to assume they're pretty even in damage. Impressive considering Shyvana's tendency to build Kingblade, Omen, Visage, Sunfire, and Tabi.
Where Zed's stat-tracking is showing him going full glass with Kingblade, Ghostblade, Whisper, and Merc Treads.

Riot did design tanky DPS champions to deal DPS when they build tank after all. It's not like they need the same offensive requirements as mages, marksman, and assassins to reach similar damage values. 

Especially seeing as tanky DPS tend to be the hybrid damage class, and:
Magic damage has 100% armor penetration.
Physical damage has 100% magic penetration.
They just tend to run with non-AD/AP sources for physical damage like TriForce, Sunfire Cape, Wit's End, Kingblade, and general crazy stuff on jungler items.

On penetrations:
> Except it actually is possible to counterbuild shyvana, considering her magic is pretty laughably small and she has zero penetration, meaning even one MR item will likely reduce her magical damage to a great extent. 

For needing penetrations - MR and Armor simply do not function in a way that requires penetrations to deal with them. 

Just as starting with 1000 HP and grabbing 1000+1000+1000 HP will offer 4 times the defense, starting with 0 MR and grabbing 100+100+100 will offer 4 times the magical resistance.

There's no wonky power-curve or hurdle you need to overcome concerning physical or magical damage within LoL. Which means reasonable damage inputs will result in reasonable damage outputs.

On needing magic penetration more particularly on champions like Shyvana, Udyr, Mundo, Wariwkc, Nasus: when you consider MR is approximately 35% lower than armor in most cases, that point makes no sense.

Through base stats alone champions either have 30 or 52.25 MR at level 18, and anywhere from 60 to 90 armor, 75 being pretty average.
Which means at least 100% more armor on ranged champions, and around 43% more to 72% more on melee.

Armor is also notably more available in higher amounts through itemization in an item-per-item comparison, often leading tanks to have ~50% more armor, or ~33% less MR, in most situations. Especially considering HP alone is pretty solid against most forms on magic damage, leading to ~150 MR being the maximum you'd ever realistically need.

If you think something like Last Whisper is a problem, why make the case having greater %penetrations bonus than Last Whisper offers is so weak it needs penetrations to function?
